content:
• Wednesday, December 14, 2016
  • VTVT

    Positive mid-stage data on diabetes candidate TTP273 propels vTv Therapeutics; shares up 15% after hours

    • Shares of vTv Therapeutics (NASDAQ:VTVT) are up 15% after hours on light volume in response to its announcement of positive results from a Phase 2 clinical trial assessing TTP273 for the treatment of type 2 diabetes.
    • Patients receiving TTP273 experienced a statistically significant reduction in HbA1c from baseline to week 12, the primary endpoint.
    • TTP273 was well-tolerated with negligible cases of nausea and vomiting across all arms. Trends in weight loss were also observed.
    • The data analysis is continuing.
    • TTP273, utilizing the company's TTP Translational Technology, is an orally administered glucagon-like peptide-1 receptor (GLP-1R) agonist. Its value proposition is the avoidance of injections and gastrointestinal side effects like nausea and vomiting.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • ATHN

    Athenahealth releases 2017 guidance, sees non-GAAP income as high as $190M; shares up 21% after hours

    • Athenahealth (NASDAQ:ATHN) reaffirms its 2016 guidance that it released on December 10 and provides its outlook for 2017:
    • Revenues: $1.29B - 1.33B; Operating Income: $61M - 81M; Non-GAAP Operating Income: $170M -190M; Annual Bookings: $400M - 450M.
    • Share are up 21% after hours on increased volume.
    • Management will host a webcast of its 9th Annual Investor Summit tomorrow, December 15, at 8:30 am ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:47 PM
  • FOLD

    Amicus Therapeutics readies private placement of $225M in convertible debt; shares off 11% after hours

    • Amicus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:FOLD) slumps 11% after hours on increased volume in response to its announcement that it intends to offer $225M aggregate principal amount of convertible senior notes due 2023 in a private placement. Initial purchasers will have the option to buy up to an additional $25M of the notes.
    • Price, yield and conversion rate and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Net proceeds will fund the cost of the capped call transactions (hedge to manage the potential cash payments when converted) and general corporate purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:39 PM | 5 Comments
  • FOX

    RBC: Discovery TV could do well in new video ecosystem

    • Discovery Communications (DISCA -0.3%) and fellow content makers don't necessarily face a rough future in a cord-cutting era, says RBC Capital's Steven Cahall.
    • Internet video is likely to be more "additive" than "cannibalistic" to traditional TV, he argues, even in a world where "virtual MVPDs" (DirecTV Now recently joining services like PlayStation Vue, Sling TV and even Hulu and YouTube) are taking hold.
    • Such services are "broadly constructive" for media stocks, Cahall argues -- they're not trying to disrupt the current ecosystem but rather need content, mitigating risks to subscriber growth and affiliate fees.
    • Discovery is likely to prosper vs. rivals including Fox (FOX +2.6%, FOXA +3.6%) and Walt Disney (DIS +0.2%), he writes: "We think DISCA offers the best thematic approach to shifting attitudes due to vMVPDs. It derated 29% in the Media meltdown and has some of the highest revenue exposure to network operations.
    • "It also sold off over the summer on sell-side downgrades based on the idea that it wouldn’t be in vMVPDs, yet 80% of its affiliate fees are covered in the bigger bundles."
     
     
     
     
    | 6:53 PM | 2 Comments
  • VZ

    Verizon analyst day: Focus on digital ads, not buying media firms

    • With acquisition speculation in the media sector turning its eyes to Verizon (VZ -1.4%) -- and rumors that it might follow an AT&T/Time Warner deal by making a play for CBS (CBS +0.9%) -- analysts recapping Verizon's analyst day talks are painting a picture of a company likely to stay its own course.
    • "We do not sense buying a media-content company is in any way part of its plan," says Wells Fargo's Jennifer Fritzsche, suggesting that despite some investors' wishful thinking, the company won't play for CBS or for Dish Network (DISH +2%).
    • Rather than pursue content partnerships, Verizon will keep building digital ads to counter Alphabet and Facebook. AOL's making progress, it says, with revenue up 10%, and "the company was taking a patient approach with recent investments, including Go90 (a mobile video service), Fleetmatics, and smart city initiatives," writes Jefferies' Mike McCormack.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:37 PM | 8 Comments
  • MDLZ

    Reuters: No Mondelez-Kraft deal talks

    • Mondelez International (NASDAQ:MDLZ) says it hasn't head from Kraft Heinz (NASDAQ:KHC) about a potential buyout, according to Reuters.  In addition, Mondelez advises that it has no reason to believe the report posted earlier from a Swiss magazine on a deal is true.
    • Previously: Mondelez +9% after hours on rumored Kraft Heinz interest (Dec. 14)
    • KHC +2.54% in AH trading. MDLZ +4.48%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:03 PM | 14 Comments
  • AABA

    Verizon: Will 'evaluate' breach at acquisition target Yahoo

    • Responding to news of a second, even more massive data breach of user accounts at Yahoo (YHOO), Verizon (NYSE:VZ) -- which has a $4.83B deal to acquire the Internet pioneer's business -- says it's watching the situation.
    • "As we've said all along, we will evaluate the situation as Yahoo continues its investigation," Verizon says in a statement that CNBC reported. "We will review the impact of this new development before reaching any final conclusions."
    • After a breach revealed in September that involved a believed 500M user accounts at Yahoo, Verizon's general counsel said there's "reasonable basis" to think the breach was material to its deal and said the burden was on Yahoo to prove otherwise.
    • But as lawyers discussed the news at that time, Verizon's Marni Walden said the deal "still makes sense."
    • After hours now: YHOO -2.6%; VZ +0.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:44 PM | 36 Comments
  • TALO

    Stone Energy files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy

    • Stone Energy (SGY) files for chapter 11 bankruptcy protection to pursue a pre-packaged plan of reorganization supported by top lenders and bondholders.
    • Creditors’ support for the reorganization plan, which prior regulatory filings say calls on bondholders to forgive ~$850M in debt for ownership of the reorganized company, is conditioned on SGY quickly securing court approval for the plan.
    • SGY reports assets and debts each in the $1B-$10B range in its petition.
    • SGY -16.9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:44 PM | 30 Comments

  • After-hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ATHN +20.8%. PIR +18.8%. MDLZ +9.9%. PBI +4.6%. CERN +4.2%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: SGY -16.9%. FOLD -10.8%. TLGT -5.0%.WTI -4.3%. TMUS -3.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM
  • GPOR

    Gulfport Energy to buy SCOOP acreage in $1.85B cash and stock deal

    • Gulfport Energy (NASDAQ:GPOR) agrees to acquire 85K net effective acres in the core of the Oklahoma SCOOP play from Quantum Energy Partners for $1.85B, consisting of $1.35B in cash and 18.8M common shares.
    • GPOR says the substantially contiguous acreage position includes rights to 46.4K Woodford acres and 38.6K Springer acres, with ~80% held by production; existing production totals ~183M cfe/day, and total estimated proved reserves are 1.1T cfe.
    • Four rigs are currently operating on the acreage, and GPOR says it plans to maintain a four rig cadence in the play during 2017 and add two rigs at the beginning of 2018.
    • To help fund the deal, GPOR launches a 29M-share public offering, with an underwriters option to purchase up to another 4.35M common shares, and a debt offering of $600M aggregate principal amount of senior notes due 2025.
    • GPOR -3.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM | 9 Comments
  • AABA

    Yahoo -2.1% as it discloses new hack of a billion-plus accounts

    • Yahoo (YHOO -1.4%) is disclosing a security breach -- "likely distinct" from the one it disclosed in September -- that may affect more than a billion user accounts.
    • The company got information from law enforcement last month about files that a third party said was Yahoo data, and Yahoo now believes it's legitimate. "Based on further analysis of this data by the forensic experts, Yahoo believes an unauthorized third party, in August 2013, stole data associated with more than one billion user accounts."
    • "The company has not been able to identify the intrusion associated with this theft," a Yahoo statement continues. "Yahoo believes this incident is likely distinct from the incident the company disclosed on Sept. 22, 2016."
    • The information may include names, e-mail addresses, phone numbers, dates of birth, hashed passwords and even some security questions and answers (encrypted or unencrypted).
    • After hours: YHOO -2.1%; Buyer-in-waiting Verizon (VZ -1.4%) flat.
    • Previously: Verizon exec: Yahoo deal 'still makes sense' despite security breach (Oct. 26 2016)
    • Previously: Verizon counsel: Burden's on Yahoo to prove hack is immaterial (Oct. 13 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM | 44 Comments
  • CCO

    Clear Channel Outdoor launching programmatic buying for billboards

    • Clear Channel Outdoor Americas (NYSE:CCO) today launched the first programmatic ad-buying solution for out-of-home advertising, bringing automated purchasing to its digital billboards.
    • The company is using Rubicon Project's (NYSE:RUBI) Private Marketplace in the effort.
    • The exchange will allow brands and advertisers to buy at scale from an inventory of 1,000 digital billboards across 25 of Clear Channel's 29 digital markets in the U.S.
    • Clear Channel Outdoor (a subsidiary of iHeartMedia (IHRT +3.9%)) reported early success in near-real-time pilot campaigns with its clients. Clear Channel International is also developing a programmatic solution for the European market with an announcement of plans set for January.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • APOG

    Apogee beats by $0.01, beats on revenue

    • Apogee (NASDAQ:APOG): Q3 EPS of $0.78 beats by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $274.1M (+15.0% Y/Y) beats by $1.23M.
    • Shares +2.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • ARWR

    Arrowhead FY revenues $158K; loss narrows; shares up 5% after hours

    • Beaten down micro cap Arrowhead Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARWR) inches up 5% after hours on light volume on the heels of its announcement of fiscal 2016 results.
    • Revenues were $158K (-58.6%) and net loss was ($81.7M) (+11.1%).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • FANG

    Diamondback Energy to buy Brigham Resources in $2.4B cash and stock deal

    • Diamondback Energy (NASDAQ:FANG) agrees to acquire Brigham Resources and Brigham Resources Midstream for $2.43B, consisting of $1.62B in cash and 7.69M common shares.
    • The deal includes 76.3K net leasehold acres in the highest oil content region of the Delaware Basin, with 48 producing horizontal wells; upon completion, FANG says its leasehold interests in the Permian Basin would total ~182K net surface acres.
    • To help fund the deal, FANG launches a 10.5M-share public offering, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 1.575M common shares, and a debt offering of $250M aggregate principal amount of senior notes due 2025.
    • FANG -2.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 8 Comments
  • KHC

    Mondelez +9% after hours on rumored Kraft Heinz interest

    • Citing a "very well-informed" source, Switzerland's Bilanz magazine says Kraft Heinz (NASDAQ:KHC) is putting together a bid for Mondelez (NASDAQ:MDLZ).
    • As is 3G's norm, a purchase of MDLZ would likely mean big cost (job) cuts.
    • MDLZ +8.8%, KHC +2% after hours.
    • Related: Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.A, BRK.B)
    • Previously: Buffett exit from Coca-Cola board raises M&A intrigue (Dec. 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 41 Comments
  • KCAP

    KCAP Financial -6% after dividend cut

    • The Q4 distribution will be $0.12 per share, down from $0.15 previously. The annualized dividend yield based on today's closing price drops to 11.9%.
    • KCAP -6.2% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • MGNX

    MacroGenics fails to impress at R&D day, shares fall 15%

    • Investors in MacroGenics (MGNX -15.4%) apparently did not hear what they wanted to hear in the company's R&D day yesterday. Shares slumped today on more than a 4x spike in volume and they are down over 25% this week. Key points from the event:
    • Enrollment in the phase 3 SOPHIA study assessing margetuximab + chemo compared to trastuzumab (Roche's Herceptin) + chemo in HER2+ breast cancer will not be complete until late 2018.
    • Preliminary data from the Phase 1b/2 trial assessing margetuximab + pembrolizumab (Merck's Keytruda) in HER2+ gastric and gastroesophageal cancers was from the dose escalation portion and included responders who progressed after treatment with trastuzumab + chemo.
    • Other presentations were from early-stage studies.
    • Near-term catalysts appear scarce.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • VZ

    With demand hot, Equinix doubles leveraged loan for data center acquisition

    • To fund its acquisition of data centers from Verizon (VZ -1.4%), Equinix (EQIX -1.9%) has doubled the size of a leveraged loan it's raising, after heavy demand.
    • The company's doubling the amount to €1B from a previous €500M term loan, and tightening pricing -- a move that will allow Equinix to pursue the $3.6B deal with less equity and bonds.
    • The loan will be offered at par, with an interest margin of 325 basis points over Euribor with a 0% floor.
    • Equinix is also looking to reprice an existing $248M term loan and a sterling-denominated loan of about $388M equivalent.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 6 Comments

  • Gold takes out new lows after Fed

    • The Fed hiked 25 basis points as expected, but at least somewhat unexpectedly boosted its forecast for rate hikes next year to three from two.
    • In response, interest rates and the dollar (UUP +0.9%) are surging, and gold's doing what comes naturally of late ... sliding.
    • The metal's down 1.3% to $1,144 per ounce - a price not seen since the early days of February. Gold's now off about 13% since the start of November.
    • ETFs: GLD, IAU, PHYS, SGOL, UGL, DGP, GTU, UGLD, GLL, DZZ, GLDI, OUNZ, DGL, DGZ, DGLD, GYEN, GEUR, UBG, QGLDX
     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM | 29 Comments

  • Yields surge after Fed rate hike

    • The 10-year Treasury yield is higher by seven basis points to 2.54% following the Fed rate hike and expectations for three boosts next year (up from two). That's the highest level since Sept. 2014.
    • That's a big move, but the real action is at the short end, where the two-year yield has moved up a whopping 10 basis points to 1.26%. As recently as the July 4 holiday, the two-year yield was about half of today's level.
    • We'd like to check Fed Funds futures to see what they're pricing in, but things are so busy at the CME, we can't get onto the website.
    • ETFs: IEF, SHY, PST, IEI, BIL, TYO, UST, DTYS, VGSH, SHV, VGIT, SCHO, TBX, SCHR, ITE, GSY, TYD
    • Previously: Fed now sees three rate hikes in 2017 (Dec. 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • ANET

    Arista Networks +2.2% as jury rules no infringement of Cisco IP

    • Arista Networks (ANET +2.2%) has legged higher in the wake of a legal victory over Cisco Systems (CSCO -0.3%), which has followed the market into the red.
    • A San Jose, Calif., jury has found that Arista owed no damages in Cisco's claim of copyright infringement, and also that Arista didn't infringe a Cisco patent.
    • Cisco had sought about $335M in damages from its pesky rival in a claim tied to the company's user interfaces, saying Arista has "slavishly copied" the command-line interface used to access and control switches.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM

  • Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 3:25 PM

    • Gainers: NSR +21%. COOL +11%. NH +8%. CPSH +7%. GIGM +6%.
    • Losers: AIRG -15%. CRDS -12%. OTC:VLTC -10%. OTC:FNCX -9%. AEHR -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • XOM

    Woods named to succeed Tillerson as Exxon Chairman and CEO

    • Exxon Mobil (XOM -2.4%) elects Darren Woods as its new Chairman and CEO, effective Jan. 1, replacing Rex Tillerson, who is Pres.-elect Trump's pick to become U.S. secretary of state.
    • Tillerson, who had been scheduled to retire in March 2017 when he reached 65 - the company's mandatory retirement age for his position - will now retire at year-end after more than 41 years of service.
    • Woods' selection was expected; he was promoted to president and the board of directors in December a year ago, and has been a member of XOM's six-person management committee that oversees day-to-day operations since June 2014.
    • Shares of XOM and most other energy producers have turned lower following the Fed's interest rate hike.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM | 4 Comments
  • FOX

    Post-Ailes, Fox News names new HR leader

    • Fox News (FOX +2.8%, FOXA +3.2%) has named a new head of human resources following the sexual-harassment allegations that led to the ouster of CEO Roger Ailes this summer.
    • Kevin Lord is the company's new executive VP of human resources (a new post), reporting to co-Presidents Jack Abernethy and Bill Shine. He steps into a challenge amid lingering questions about Fox News culture and whether the company went far enough to prevent misconduct during Ailes' tenure.
    • Lord has held senior HR positions at Tegna as well as at NBCUniversal and General Electric.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM | 5 Comments
  • FFIV

    F5 Networks +2.2% as Citigroup bumps to Buy with M&A possibilities

    • F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV) has picked up 2.2% today after Citigroup upgraded shares to Buy, with an eye to a possible takeover in the new year.
    • The company is Citigroup's top pick in IT hardware, analyst Jim Suva says, bumping Cisco Systems (NASDAQ:CSCO) from that perch: "We shift Cisco Systems lower, still maintaining a buy rating, given the (potential) tax benefits from a Trump administration."
    • The company, the leading maker of application delivery controllers, is a potential M&A target in the coming year, he notes.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM | 2 Comments
  • HTZ

    Confidence in Hertz Global weak even after CEO switch

    • Analysts are buzzing over Hertz Global (HTZ -6.8%) after the company named a new CEO late yesterday.
    • Morgan Stanley (Equal Weight, $30 PT) sees more management departures for Hertz and for shares to stay under pressure.
    • Goldman Sachs (Sell, $22 PT) thinks Hertz's EBITDA margin guidance of 16% to 18% may be too aggressive.
    • Credit Suisse (Neutral, $27 PT) isn't sure a new CEO is the solution. "We believe investors should note that Ms. Marinello will be the 3rd CEO at Hertz in ~2 years," notes analyst Anjaneya Singh.
    • Previously: Hertz names Marinello as new president/CEO; Icahn approves (Dec. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 22 Comments
  • DRWI

    DragonWave gets compliance extension from Nasdaq

    • DragonWave (DRWI +1.8%) has gotten an extension from Nasdaq to get back into listing compliance.
    • The exchange granted an extension until April 17 for the company to get back to $2.5M minimum in shareholder equity.
    • DragonWave had fallen into noncompliance in October after its shareholder equity (for the period ended Aug. 31) slipped to $1.662M.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 2 Comments
  • CAT

    Higher steel prices could be bad news for Caterpillar, Navistar, Agco

    • Machinery stocks such as Caterpillar (CAT -1.5%), Navistar (NAV -3.2%) and Agco (AGCO -1.5%) have priced in the positive impact from tax cuts, infrastructure spending and a stronger economy, but they do not necessarily reflect the negative impact from rising commodity prices, Barclays analysts say.
    • Rising commodities are normally a positive for machinery and industrials, but Barclays believes the market is still in overhang from the last cycle, which included some of the largest fleet builds in history in construction, mining, locomotive, agriculture, and oil and gas, and used pricing remains weak and sometimes is still falling.
    • The firm cuts its out-year EPS for Agco to $2.50 from $2.90, for CAT to $3.16 from $3.60, and for NAV to a loss of $0.17 from a loss of $0.10.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM | 7 Comments
  • BAC

    Hawkish "dots" sends banks higher

    • The Fed now expects three 25 basis point rate hikes next year vs. a previous guess of just two. That's manna to yield starved banks, insurers, and brokerages.
    • While the S&P 500 (SPY -0.3%) and Nasdaq (QQQ -0.3%) log small losses, the financials are taking off. XLF +0.8%, KRE +1.1%, KBE +0.9%
    • Bank of America (BAC +2.7%), Citigroup (C +1.4%), JPMorgan (JPM +1.2%), Morgan Stanley (MS +2.1%), Regions (RF +2.7%), KeyCorp (KEY +2.1%), Fifth Third (FITB +1.7%), U.S. Bancorp (USB +1%), MetLife (MET +1.2%), Schwab (SCHW +2%), E*Trade (ETFC +2.5%), Northern Trust (NTRS +1.3%), AIG (AIG +0.8%), AmEx (AXP +1.5%)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM | 65 Comments
  • X

    U.S. Steel to re-start idle Granite City hot strip mill

    • U.S. Steel (X +4.6%) is higher following yesterday's announcement that it will partially reopen the idle hot strip mill in Granite City, Ill., in February, calling back 220 laid off workers.
    • Granite City Works blast furnaces and steel making facilities were closed in December 2015 and will remain idled; the hot strip mill, which finishes steel made elsewhere, was closed in January 2016.
    • Macquarie analysts praise the strategy behind the move, despite the lack of volume impact, as it allows U.S. Steel to perform needed maintenance and upgrading on its three other major hot strip mill operations while losing little shipping volume to customers.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM | 8 Comments
  • AMD

    UBS restates Advanced Micro Devices at Sell

    • Sharply contrary to commentary out of Canaccord Genuity following yesterday's Zen and Ryzen developments, UBS' Stephen Chin reiterates a $5.50 target on Advanced Micro Devices (AMD +1.7%).
    • Remains unconvinced, noting AMD's processor performance was compared against Intel's 6th-generation, 14nm Skylake microarchitecture, and with 7th-generation Kaby Lake offerings estimated 10%-15% quicker and 10nm Cannonlake processors expected in 2017, considers any performance advantage at AMD to potentially be short-lived.
    • Positive investor sentiment, however, is currently outweighing negative with AMD trading up 1.7% on the session, 57.5% over the month and 357% over the year-term to $10.72.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM | 177 Comments
  • SNDX

    Syndax Pharma teams up with NCI to develop cancer therapy candidates entinostat and SNDX-6352; shares ahead 3%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Syndax Pharmaceuticals (SNDX +3.4%) perks up on light volume in response to its announcement that it has entered into a Cooperative Research and Development Agreement with the National Cancer Institute (NCI). The partnership includes collaborating with NCI's Laboratory of Tumor Immunology and Biology to assess the therapeutic benefits of lead product candidate entinostat and pipeline candidate SNDX-6352.
    • Entinostat is a small molecule that inhibits an enzyme class called histone deacetylases (HDACs), specifically Class 1 HDACs which play a key role in modulating immuno-suppressive cells called myeloid-derived suppressor cells (MDSCs) and regulatory T cells. The company says entinostat has therapeutic potential in a range of cancers when used in combination with immune checkpoint inhibitors.
    • SNDX-6352, a humanized IgG4 monoclonal antibody with high affinity against colony-stimulating factor 1 receptor (CSF-1R), is in development for the potential treatment of neoplastic diseases.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Gainers: MDLY +7%.
    • Losers: OTC:FNBC -23%. PN -8%. FXCM -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: VCEL +60%. BCLI +22%. NSR +20%. ENT +13%. SKIS +13%. SKLN +12%. EGT +10%. COOL +10%. SMRT +10%. INFU +9%.
    • Losers: OTC:FNBC -23%. DELT -17%. MSLI -16%. PRTO -16%. FF -15%. MGNX -16%. GLF -15%. OTC:ANW -13%. CRDS -12%. USEG -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • SMRT

    Stein Mart digs out from post-earnings hole

    • Shares of Stein Mart (NASDAQ:SMRT) are up 10.20% on volume already 2X normal activity.
    • The retailer is trying to recover from a sharp post-earnings drop tied to merchandising strategies that didn't pan out.
    • Previously: Stein Mart admits marketing misfire impacted results (Nov. 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMD

    Advanced Micro Devices target raised to $13 at Canaccord Genuity

    • From $8.75 before (current price $10.63), analyst Matthew Ramsay attributes recent upward momentum generated though value expansion, rising conviction in CPU and GPU roadmaps, and catalysts reading positive for gaming revenue.
    • Retains shares at Buy.
    • Advanced Micro Devices (AMD +0.9%) has reversed higher by 2%+ intraday into positive territory since opening the day in the red subsequent yesterday's previewing of Zen and unveiling of Ryzen.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM | 11 Comments
  • MSLI

    Merus Labs slumps 15% on fiscal year-end and Q4 results; modest growth in non-GAAP earnings expected

    • Thinly traded micro cap Merus Labs International (MSLI -15.4%) retreats on almost a 5x surge in volume, albeit on only 71K shares, in response to its announcement of fiscal Q4 and full-year results.
    • Fiscal Q4 product sales: $34.3M; Non-GAAP EBITDA: $11.6M.
    • Fiscal 2016 product sales: $62.3M; Non-GAAP EBITDA: $43.2M.
    • Fiscal 2017 Guidance: Non-GAAP EBITDA: $44M - 48M.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • CRWS

    Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Losers: CRWS -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • PTE

    Majesco Entertainment sets clinical advisory board in corporate transition

    • Continuing in its transition to become Polarity after moving to acquire the medical tissue company PolarityTE, videogame maker Majesco Entertainment (COOL) has announced a clinical advisory board to help guide products to market.
    • Drs. Michael Grant, Stephen Milner and Anand Kumar joined the board, which will "play a critical role in translating our regenerative technology into pragmatic clinical practice, helping us address the realities of the field on a real-time basis," says CEO Denver Lough.
    • The company named Michael Neumeister its chief medical officer last week, a day after announcing it intended to merger with PolarityTE and change its name.
    • Shares have moved up 9% today after a big block trade; they're up 32.7% since the merger announcement.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM | 5 Comments

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: VCEL +50%. BCLI +21%. SKLN +13%. RETA +8%. INFU +7%.
    • Losers: MSLI -14%. PRTO -13%. MGNX -12%. TROV -12%. NVCN -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • BRKR

    Bruker slips 4% on JPMorgan downgrade

    • Bruker (BRKR -3.6%) eases on average volume in apparent response to a downgrade to Neutral by JPMorgan. The price target is $20 (7% downside risk).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM

  • Crude inventory declines

    • EIA Petroleum Inventories:
    • Crude -2.6M barrels vs. -1.6M consensus, -2.4M last week.
    • Gasoline +0.5M barrels vs. +2.5M consensus, +3.4M last week.

  • BCLI

    Positive NurOwn study data stokes Brainstorm Cell; shares up 20%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Brainstorm Cell Therapeutics (BCLI +19.9%) jumps on a healthy 41x surge in volume in response to its announcement of positive results from a 48-subject Phase 2 study assessing NurOwn in patients with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS). The data were presented at the 27th International Symposium on ALS/MND in Dublin, Ireland.
    • Analyses of cerebral-spinal fluid from ALS patients treated with NurOwn showed statistically significant increases in levels of certain neurotrophic factors and statistically significant reductions in certain inflammatory markers over the same period compared to placebo.
    • Also, a greater number of NurOwn-treated patients achieved 100% improvement in a functional rating scale called ALSFR-R versus placebo. The definition of responders by this criterion means their disease symptoms were essentially halted during the period of the treatment effect.
    • NurOwn cells are mesenchymal stem cells that have been induced, via the company's proprietary methods, to secrete a variety of neurotrophic factors.
    • Its development is ongoing.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM | 1 Comment

    Galena commences mid-stage study NeuVax study in type of breast cancer; shares ahead 9% premarket

    • Thinly traded nano cap Galena Biopharma (GALE) is up 9% premarket on light volume in response to its announcement that enrollment has commenced in its Phase 2 study, VADIS, assessing NeuVax (nelipepimut-S) for the treatment of women with ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS), a noninvasive cancer found in the lining of the breast duct.
    • The primary endpoint of the 108-subject trial is the change in the number of nelipepimut-S-cytotoxic T lymphocytes from baseline (pre-vaccination) to up to one month post vaccination. According to ClinicalTrials.gov, the estimated final data collection date for the primary endpoint is March 2019.
    • NeuVax is an HER2-directed immunotherapy being investigated for the prevention of breast cancer recurrence after standard-of-care treatment in the adjuvant setting. Adjuvant therapy is any treatment given after primary (first-line) therapy.

    • Nano cap Protalix BioTherapeutics (NYSEMKT:PLX) is up 17% premarket on robust volume in response to its announcement that it received a letter from an arm of the Brazilian Ministry of Health that it intends to buy $24M of alfataliglicerase in 2017 to treat Gaucher patients.     • The company says the anticipated revenues could reduce its cash consumption by as much as 33% next year and could possibly reach breakeven thereafter if Brazil follows through on larger purchases as indicated in the letter.
    • Alfataliglicerase is a plant cell-expressed form of the glucocerebrosidase enzyme that was approved by the Brazilian National Health Surveillance Agency in March 2013 for the long-term treatment of adults with Type I Gaucher disease and in November 2016 for the long-term treatment of children at least four years old with Type I Gaucher.

  • OPEC: We can't go it alone on cuts

    • "OPEC production adjustment alone wouldn't be enough to clear the total overhang” of 300M barrels currently in storage, says the cartel in its first monthly report since agreeing to (OPEC) production cuts.
    • At issue is a subsequent agreement with non-cartel producers (namely Russia) for them to reduce output alongside OPEC.
    • History has shown it's not too easy to enforce production limits even within OPEC, leading some to question whether any non-OPEC deal has any chance of succeeding.
    • OPEC producers boosted production by about 150K barrels per day in November, including Saudi Arabia, which pumped out an additional 95K bpd.
    • Oil this morning is lower by 1.4% to $52.23 per barrel.
